definition: to afford or give pleasure or satisfaction

like, wish                                      
             
             do as you please

to have the kindness                                      
             
             will you please to enter the carriage
to give pleasure to : gratify

to be the will or pleasure of                                      
             
             may it please Your Majesty
—used as a function word to express politeness or emphasis in a request          please come in
—used as a function word to express polite affirmation          like some tea? Please
—used as a function word to express scornful disagreement, disapproval, or disbelief          you believe that? Oh, please
to make (someone) happy or satisfied
to make a choice about what to do, have, etc.
—used to ask for something in a polite way
—used to show that a request is serious or important
—used as a polite way of saying yes

to make happy or satisfied                                      
             
             The gift pleased him.

to be willing : like, choose                                      
             
             You can come and go as you please.
—used to show politeness or emphasis in requesting or accepting          May I please be excused?Attention, please!More milk? Yes, please.
in: do as you please
will you please to enter the carriage
may it please Your Majesty
please come in
like some tea? Please
you believe that? Oh, please
He joined the football team to please his father.
Her parents were pleased by her decision.
It pleases me to know that you liked the gift.
They're very hard to please.
The gift pleased him.
You can come and go as you please.
May I please be excused?
Attention, please!
More milk? Yes, please.

definition: used as a polite way of asking for something or of asking someone to do something
used for emphasizing a request, an order, or a statement
used for asking someone to stop doing something annoying
used as a polite way of accepting something that someone has offered you
used for saying that you think someone has said something silly
in: Would you help me with these bags, please?
Could I have change for a pound, please?
Can you tell me how much this costs, please?
Please stop making all that noise!
‘Do you mind if we come in?’ ‘Please do.’
Please note that there will be no class next Thursday.
Billy, please! I’m warning you!
yes, please: ‘Would you like some more coffee?’ ‘Yes, please.’
‘Why don’t you join a gym?’ ‘At my age? Oh, please!’

definition: used to make a request more polite:
used to add force to a request or demand:
used especially by children to a teacher or other adult in order to get their attention:
used when accepting something politely or enthusiastically:
to make someone feel happy or satisfied, or to give someone pleasure:
to want, like, or choose, when used with words such as "whatever", "whoever", and "anywhere":
used to express surprise and anger:
commonly used in order to make a request more polite, or, sometimes, to make it stronger or urgent:
in: Could I have two coffees and a tea, please?
Please remember to close the windows before you leave.
Please, David, put the knife down.
Oh, please. Do shut up!
Please, Miss, I know the answer!
"More potatoes?" "Please."
"May I bring my husband?" "Please do."
"Would you like dessert?" "Oh, yes please."
I only got married to please my parents.
He was always a good boy, very friendly and eager to please.
It always pleases me to see a well-designed book!
She thinks she can just do whatever/as she pleases.
I shall go out with whoever I please.
They want £200, if you please, just to replace a couple of broken windows!
Take your seats, ladies and gentlemen, if you please.
Could I please have some ketchup for my hamburger?
Please be sure to take all your personal belongings when you leave the train.
Please do as I say and don’t ask questions.
"Would you like some more salad?" "Please (= yes, I would)."
He did what he could to please her, but she was hard to please.
I’m pleased to report that sales have increased by 15%.
She’ll listen to what you say, but in the end she’ll do as/what she pleases (= what she wants to do).
To please the experimenter, children might have produced labels about which they were uncertain.
If you think that two adjacent statements apply, please circle both.
One might prefer to be a gardener - simply pleasing oneself in the making of such a choice.
A vocal delivery that might seem haughty or conceited, too mellifluous or elegant, excessively 'musical', or calculated to please others must be avoided.
However, if we want to provide a more aesthetically pleasing and realistic animation, an elastic behaviour for the link of the operation would seem appropriate.
If you would like to discuss ideas for articles, please contact one of the editors.
Monetary incentives do not completely "crowd out" the subject's motive to please, but they are likely to attenuate this motive considerably.
In other words, husbands were not expected to simply dispose of their wives as they pleased.
In initial position the accentual status of please is somewhat controversial.
Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each statement.
It is pleasing to find articles from regional newspapers which present their material with the authority of local knowledge.
If anyone knows where these materials are to be found, please let the author or this reviewer know.
In relation to the latter it is especially pleasing that basic word lists for languages representing four of these groups are included as an appendix.
Please provide at least two contexts in which the child used each word.
Conversely, nonlocals' use of please backfires because acting "proper" asser ts superiority in terms not locally condoned.

translated_as@ru: что угодно/как угодно и т. д.

translated_as@fr: je vous prie de ne pas jouer au ballon dans la maison.
Elle s’efforçait de faire plaisir à son père.
Il n’est pas facile à satisfaire.

definition: an expression of joy or laughter in response to a funny joke/statement. typically a substitute for "LOL", "LMAO", etc.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
the magic word
another word for "now".
Please is the magic word. The MAGIC word. PLEASE. uh uh
Provide Legal Exculpation And Sign Everything
In Cincinnati (Cincy), this is slang/short for "Could you please repeat that?"
